title: Episode 27 - "Surprise"
guest_stars: Vinnie Dombroski, Jimmie Walker, Mike Watt, Dennis Diken, Pat DiNizio, Juliana Hatfield, Ben Folds, Cameron Diaz, Mark McEwen, Wes Johnson, Dr. Robert Bakker, Matt Talbott, Judy Tenuta, Lori Fetrick, Steve Henneberry, Method Man, Jill Cunniff, Rodney Trevon Oliver, Rev. Norbert St. Louis, Les Claypool, Larry Lalonde, Bobcat Goldthwait

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Pssst, Moltar! Is the Ghost around?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Okay, get this! I told him he had a package, down in the mail room. (laughs) I laid a buncha traps for him, along the way. Y'know, to slow him down a little.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (fighting a giant stone creature) You want a piece of me? Well, COME GET SOME! Ow!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I kinda want to give him a surprise party. And I'm gonna round up the Council of Doom to "help out". (laughs) That's "help out" with quotes around it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on the monitor, fighting a giant blue robot) You want a piece of me? Well, come... (robot pounds him into the ground) Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, you and the band can do the music, right? Y'know, your standard party gig. He'll be thirty this year!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Thirty? (impersonating Gary Coleman) Whatch'you talkin' 'bout, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm serious! Dead serious, if you know what I mean! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ahh! I get it! Surprise! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! Surprise! Boom! (evil laugh) (long pause) Hey Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still being pounded into the ground) If this is a bad time, I can check back.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Has Space Ghost made it to the mail room yet?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws a lever, revealing Space Ghost on the monitor, being attacked by a space spider) Ehh, he's gonna be a while.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm gonna take over the show until he returns... if he returns! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: "Zorak Coast to Coast." Mmm, I rather like that. Christy, play me to the desk!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Please welcome my first guest. (screen lowers with Vinnie) Identify yourself!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, what do ya think, he shows up here promptly at three o'clock every day, you could do the studio up all nice with your webs and all.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know, streamers, lanterns, little webby basket party favors, all that crap. He likes those frilly things.

transcript.speaker: Black Widow
transcript.dialogue: How about a little something that will ensnare the ghost and strangle his soul and place his consciousness into a never ending painful inferno! ¡Los supremos tormentos!

transcript.speaker: Jimmie Walker
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Two teens and a monkey, well...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Good one! (blasts him) Make me laugh!

transcript.speaker: Black Widow
transcript.dialogue: (to Moltar) Now, how about noisemakers? We hand out earplugs to everyone except the ghost, and toot our little horns! Blam! Damaged ear canal! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, how's it going? Package for Space Ghost, please.

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: Ghost, ghost, ghost. Hmmm... Nope, no Ghost here.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Smithereens. How would you like it if I blew you to smithereens! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Naw, I guess that's kinda dumb.

transcript.speaker: Pat DiNizio
transcript.dialogue: Yosemite Sam would say, "I'll blow you varmints to smithereens".

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blasts them) I don't watch that show.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Metallus) It'll be beautiful, man! Beautiful!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to my show. Are you getting enough oxygen, my sweet?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ah, what do I care? (blasts her)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uhhh, what do you mean, "I need ID"?

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: How do I know you're not some imposter? I mean, if you were from another dimension, and ended up being an evil twin, a clone or something.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I beg your pardon! I believe I saved this whole department from The Diabolical Mailer! I saved you all, and this is the thanks I get!

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: Saved lives or not, sir, I still need to see ID.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Holy Tim Schnack! You guys are worse than payroll!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Thanks for coming back, folks. Space Ghost is, ah... out. So I'll be filling in for him until he returns.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: All r-r-right, how's this? (Hawaiian music in background) We have a Polynesian bovine feast, a luau if you will.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Yes, yes, yes, and we'll call it "Lu Wow", exclamation point! And we'll have Black Widow pass out leis, with a little kissy for each in attendance, and we'll caper about in our little grass pinafores to delicious calypso melodies, and we'll limbo until dawn and then some. Oh, it will be glorious!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Wait, wait, wait, wait! That's going a bit overboard, don't you think?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I see, you want to downplay it. Well then, how about Mar-di G-r-ras? (Dixieland jazz music in background) Fanciful hats and disguises, body paint, capering about in the hedges! Oh, and the dancing! And don't forget the crawfish! Don't forget to pinch the tail! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Oh, no, no, no, no, no! We want to get in close and personal. And then, WHAM! (evil laugh) Hit him hard! Humiliate him! Make the baby cry! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, aren't we the bitter little spitfire!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, for humanity! If I were, say, Superman, and I wanted to pick up a package for Clark Kent...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Batman for Bruce Wayne, or that poser Adam West?

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: What are you getting at, mister?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How'd you like it if I zapped you good?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Well, how about a fifties motif? (Fifties music in background) I'll pretend to be R-r-reggie, the loathsome miscreant from the w-r-rong side of the t-r-racks.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: You, my good man, can be Molly, my good times gal, torn between her cherished beau and her wealthy patrician family that despises his vulgar ways.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I'll be right over, meine liebschen! Shall we cater?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, that's already taken care of. (throws a switch, Lokar disappears and is replaced by Tansut)

transcript.speaker: Mark McEwen
transcript.dialogue: You want to see me do my Ramones impersonation?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Wait a second. You're not Al Roker!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Can we hit him with the rusty metal?

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Last time you wouldn't let me hit him with the rusty metal!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, now, I didn't say that!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: You did, you said that the rusty metal would cut him...

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: And you said that the rusty metal might give him an infection. You did, you said that! That's what you said!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Look, are you coming over or not?

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: I, I don't know. I'll have to think about it.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (on the verge of crying) It's just that every time you call me, I come all the way over there, and I don't get to do jack!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know what? I don't even care if you come to my stupid party anymore!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Well, maybe I don't want to come!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, maybe I don't want you to come!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (pause) So, should I bring a cake or something?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, fine, I don't have an ID. Is that what you want me to say? I left it in the Phantom Cruiser. I forgot it! Now, give me my stinkin' package!

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry, sir, but you'll have to go back to your, "Phantom Cruiser", did you call it, and get your ID, because ain't no package leaving here without one. You get me, big guy?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, wait. I'll let you see under my mask.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll let you see under my mask.

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: I don't have time for this, Space Man, Space Master. You getting it?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I like to eat used cotton swabs with earwax on 'em! And, um, pieces of curb.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No! I said, food! I need you to bring food, to the party!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: What kind of food do you want me to bring?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It has to be edible! Edible!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Ohhhh, I know what I like to eat!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I'm not a cook, I'm a villain!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This is it? All that trouble for this crappy little envelope?

transcript.speaker: Mailroom Guy
transcript.dialogue: Look, what do you want from me? A parade?

transcript.speaker: Dr. Robert Bakker
transcript.dialogue: A nose flute, a big nose flute. L-i-i-i-i-ke that.

transcript.speaker: Matt Talbott
transcript.dialogue: I don't think I have a lot of enemies, I make a lot of friends.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Everybody's here. Lokar's got the theme figured out, Widow's decorating, Metallus will work the crowd, Tansut's got the food, and Brak, well, who knows what he's doing, and you guys got... (interrupted by noise)

transcript.speaker: Black Widow
transcript.dialogue: Shut up! Shut up! Here he comes!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I think I see him.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I gotta go to the bathroom!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not just an envelope! It's the envelope! The envelope of goodness!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ehhh!! Keep it away from me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It gives me the power to get twelve CD's for a penny!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What are those, drapes? Moltar, what are those drapes doing on the set?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm just going to blast them then.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, No!! No no no! Um, uh, er, I, I wouldn't, um, uh... (pause) okay, go ahead.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: (from behind drapes) Oh, no, don't harm me! I am a tired old set of d-r-rapes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But, you don't match my desk. (blasts them)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: My bottom's on fire! (smoke continues to billow) Roll the credits!
